title: India's Wheat Procurement Begins Strong, Signaling Robust Harvest
description: India has purchased 2.08 million metric tons of new-season wheat since March 15, up 44.4% from last year, indicating a robust crop that will help shore up depleted reserves and avoid imports.

title: Tractor and Fertilizer Sales Reflect Strong Farm Sector Growth
description: Sales of tractors and fertilizers have shown impressive growth in 2024-25, serving as reliable indicators of a strong performance in India's agricultural sector.

title: SKUAST-K Conducts Seed Distribution Program for Tribal Farmers
description: The KVK Budgam, in collaboration with KVK Pulwama, organized a Seed Distribution cum Awareness Programme for tribal farmers in Budgam, aiming to enhance agricultural practices in the region.

title: Govt’s Codar Mango Farm Gets Exclusive Plot for Goan Varieties
description: In an effort to conserve and popularize indigenous mango varieties of Goa, the Agriculture Department has developed a dedicated plot at the Codar farm.

title: PJTAU and BITS Pilani Partner to Bring AI into Agriculture
description: Professor Jayashankar Telangana State Agricultural University and BITS Pilani have partnered to integrate artificial intelligence into farming practices, aiming to revolutionize agriculture through technology.

title: India Harvests 38% of Wheat Area So Far in 2025–26 Season
description: India has harvested 38% of its estimated 32 million hectares of wheat for the 2025-26 marketing season, with favorable conditions reported across key wheat-producing states.

title: Farmers' Conclave cum Kisan Mela Held at ICAR Complex
description: A 'One Day Farmers' Conclave cum Kisan Mela' was successfully conducted at the ICAR complex in Lamphelpat, aiming to disseminate knowledge and innovations among farmers.

title: Agrinnovate India Pays Dividend of Rs 1.42 Crore for FY 2023–24
description: Agrinnovate India has paid a dividend of Rs 1.42 crore for the financial year 2023–24, reflecting its commitment to promoting agricultural innovations.
